files.patch:
@@ -38,1 +38,12 @@ - * Where a method returns a type mirror or a collection of type + * Most methods operate on {@linkplain PrimitiveType primitive types}, + * {@linkplain ReferenceType reference types} (including {@linkplain + * ArrayType array types} and the {@linkplain NullType null type}), + * {@linkplain IntersectionType intersection types}, and the + * pseudo-type '{@link TypeKind#VOID void}'. {@linkplain + * ExecutableType Executable types} and the pseudo-types for + * {@linkplain TypeKind#PACKAGE packages} and {@linkplain + * TypeKind#MODULE modules} are generally out of scope for these + * methods. One or more out of scope arguments will typically result + * in a method throwing an {@link IllegalArgumentException}. + * + *

Where a method returns a type mirror or a collection of type @@ -214,0 +225,1 @@ + * @jls 4.2 Primitive Types and Values @@ -219,0 +231,1 @@ + * @jls 4.1 The Kinds of Types and Values @@ -248,1 +261,2 @@ - * an array + * an array, including executable, package, module, and wildcard types + * @jls 10.1 Array Types @@ -261,0 +275,1 @@ + * @jls 4.5.1 Type Arguments of Parameterized Types
